titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Search for Common Ground records, 1980s - 2000s
titlestmt.subtitle: Search for Common Ground C0278
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jordan Patty

publicationstmt.publisher: George Mason University. Libraries. Special Collections Research Center

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-02-16T11:19-0500

change.item: Converted to schema conforming EAD by dtd2schema.vh.xsl.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Search for Common Ground records

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Libraries. Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: 111 videotape cassettes that document the work of Search for Common Ground.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: SCRC does not have the capability to view betacam videocassettes. These items may require digitization in order to be viewed.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on personal use. Permission to publish material from the Search for Common Ground records must be obtained from Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Search for Common Ground records, C0278, Special Collections Research Center, George Mason University Libraries.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed by Amanda Brent in 2017. EAD markup completed by Amanda Brent in 2017. Finding aid updated by Amanda Brent in February 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Search for Common Ground is an international non-profit organization with the aim of promoting and implementing peaceful, non-adversarial conflict resolutions. The organization was founded in 1982 by John Marks, and is currently headquartered in Washington, D.C. and Brussels, Belgium. The organization also operates media production through Common Ground Productions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 111 videotape cassettes that document the work of Search for Common Ground, mostly masters in betacam format of programs the organization made in past years - "Shape of the Future" from Israel-Palestine, "Nashe Maalo" from Macedonia, Africa: Search for Common Ground , pan-African, and the "Search for Common Ground " series for US public television.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in order of size, the original order in which it was received by the donor, and numerically within the original order, respectively. Note: When numbers were not provided for individual tapes, they were placed after numbered tapes from the boxes/in the order they were received in.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections Research Center also holds several other collection on conflict resolution, including the , the , and the
